intro: Strychnos leiocarpa, commonly known as the white-stemmed strychnos, is a small evergreen shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Loganiaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that contain seeds surrounded by a fleshy, reddish pulp. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
